_comment: AI Configuration for IgnaCheck Compliance Analysis
_instructions: Add this configuration to your appsettings.json or appsettings.Development.json file

_provider_options.Provider: Choose 'Claude' or 'OpenAI' as your primary AI provider

For_Production.Reason: Claude Sonnet 3.5 excels at compliance analysis with superior reasoning. Low temperature ensures consistent, factual responses. No caching to save storage.

For_Development.Reason: Enable caching in development to speed up repeated tests without re-extracting text from documents.

Cost_Optimization.Reason: GPT-4o is more cost-effective than Claude Opus while maintaining high quality.

Temperature_Guide.0.8-1.0: Creative, varied responses (Not recommended for compliance)

Fallback_Strategy.Enabled: If primary provider fails, automatically use the other provider
Fallback_Strategy.Disabled: Only use the primary provider, fail if unavailable

Text_Caching.Disabled (CacheExtractedText: false): Extract text on-demand during analysis. Saves database storage. Recommended for production.
Text_Caching.Enabled (CacheExtractedText: true): Store extracted text in database. Faster analysis but uses more storage. Good for development or high-frequency analysis.

_security_notes: NEVER commit API keys to source control
Use environment variables or Azure Key Vault for production
Set API keys via: export AI__Claude__ApiKey='your-key'
Or use User Secrets in development: dotnet user-secrets set 'AI:Claude:ApiKey' 'your-key'
Azure deployment: Use App Settings or Key Vault references

_cost_estimates_per_1M_tokens.Note: Prices as of 2024. Check provider websites for current rates.
